column5: What do you think its worth? Would you take it for trolling on lake O on calm days?  http://toronto.kijiji.ca/c-cars-vehicles-b...QAdIdZ104142537  Thanks for any input!  EDIT: Also any guesses on weight? Ive got an Nissan Xtrail with a 2,000 lb towing capacity.
I like it.  Only thing I would question is the size of the motor.  Would rather have 50+ hp.
I think it's priced too high. It's 13 years old.
I also think it's priced too high.
I agree - that is a 4500.00 package.
Looks like a good rig.   Priced too high.
nice rig but yeah priced to high  cheers!
What does the pike on the rock, have to do with the sale?  Offer 3900.Whats the worst he can say?  Does look like a nice clean ride though.

For $6200 you can have my 18'er and go on Lake O whenever you want LOL. I don't think it's a bad boat but the number that came to my mind was $4500 as well. If you want a Lake O boat, buy a Lake O boat. These aluminiums do nicely on big water and small, don't limit yourself of fishing opportunities if you can avoid it.
I agree Slowpoke, I picked up a 17' Ranger with a 115 hp last year and have to watch both Erie and Ontario on which days that I could get out.  It's all in what you're looking for.
Check this one out.. it's half the price..  http://toronto.kijiji.ca/c-cars-vehicles-b...QAdIdZ108564573  I'd be interested, but I'm looking for something in the 10-12K range....in 3 months.
The boat is not big enough for Great Lakes running unless you're staying inside the 1 mile mark. As the others said, priced too high.  As for appx weight: on trailer roughly 1000lbs. all out.
When can I pick it up ?

I have an older 17 foot SmokerCraft a little fancier layout inside and usable on Lake Erie,  if the weather conditions are good. If not it`s an inland lake boat, mine has a 35 merc, rough weather you can`t get off the water quick enough.  Second boat is a copy of my neighbors old boat, same motor, and slower than mine, good boat for inland lakes.  Didn`t notice the price on boat 2 but boat 1 seems high.
http://www.trader.ca/powerpage/details.asp...mp;adid=7358087  What do you guys value that one at?  My budget is $7,000 max
I think 7k is a decent price for that. I think it should be a 50 on the back though.

No experience with legend boats, looks like a decent enough outfit, but like Dan I question the motor size. Mine was rated for 60 HP and came with a 35 as a package deal, always kicked myself in the butt for not upgrading to at least a 50hp.  I didn`t need speed to catch fish, it is nice to be able to move around a little quicker on a big body of water, running time cuts into fishing time. Two good sized guys and gear will slow you down with a 30 hp.
